messages.subject: it won't be pretty but Pris is doing RAIN DANCES!!!
messages.msgSnippet: HOLD ON CARRON!!!  @ 10 pm the weatherman said WE *SHOULD* HAVE RAIN TOMORROW??? OR SATURDAY???!!!  so just keep your eye on the GULF!!!  YAH!!! it only
messages.messageBody:
HOLD ON CARRON!!! @ 10 pm the weatherman said WE *SHOULD* HAVE RAIN
TOMORROW??? OR SATURDAY???!!! so just keep your eye on the GULF!!! YAH!!!
it only reached 96* today and felt GREAT, 15* LOWER than Tuesday's 111*!!!
AARRGGHH!!!

the San Marcos, Guadulupe and Frio Rivers are still running, which I'm SO
surprised they haven't dried up ... I saw a report that the Blanco River was
BONE DRY (I think it wsa the BR)??? AND SO MANY GRASS FIRES!!! the
countryside is just PARCHED!!! dh said he's really nervous b/c sparks from
the wheels of the train start fires all the time and MANY of the tankcars
are FLAMABLE materials; wellllllll great, that's just one more thing to
worry about while he's on the road :(

btw ... since you are a Dallasonian do you know the name of the park/area
that has the dinosaur tracks located near Dallas??? we wanted to see this
next week but for the LIFE OF ME, I don't recall the name??? tia :)

*YES*, we almost had to pull air out our sweaters from mothballs today b/c
it *only* reached 96*!!! ohhhhh, it felt GREAT ... it's funny how just 15*
LOWER helps you keep your SANITY!!! :}

Pris ~> who'll be doing a HAPPY RAIN DANCE OF JOY tomorrow and who'z JUMPING
EACH TIME THE PHONE RINGS b/c THIS CALL COULD BE *THE CALL* ABOUT THE
G-BABY???!!!
Pris ~> who'z GonnaBSOMEBODY'ZGrambyin6SHORTDAYZ!!! 8*)
WARNING: I cannot be help responsible for the above, as apparently my cats
have learned how to type ...


----- Original Message -----
From: <Cararmst@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, September 07, 2000 8:57 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] rain dance

> OOh, you promise so much. . .My, my, it hasn't rained here in Dallas since
> June 30th. That's something like 70 days. I really want to go tubing in
the
> Hill Country, but I don't think they have any rivers left down there.
(Hey,
> Pris -- you're in San Antonio, aren't you? Isn't there someone else on
the
> list who's down round there in the Hill Country?) Anything you'd like to
> ship down would be greatly appreciated. Either that or a recipe for a
rain
> dance.
>
> Carron
